channel.title: Any security or privacy risk if I replace xfce with i3?
channel.description:
I'm thinking about replacing xfce with i3 window manager in my Whonix VM. First of all, I imagine it to be as easy as purging xfce packages and installing i3 with `apt`. Correct me if that's wrong.
But are there any security or privacy risk if I do this? One thing I can think of is that if a workstation VM is compromised, the user's anonymity can be affected. Because there are less people who customize Whonix workstation and use i3.
What are some other risks?
